Method_Outcome.evidence: Primary outcomes included GI-2 recovery (tolerance of solid diet and stool passage), time to first defaecation, and safety endpoints.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Seven RCTs involving 849 patients were included.

Result_Outcome.evidence: GI motility agents significantly accelerated GI-2 recovery (mean difference –1.01 days; 95% CI –1.29 to –0.73; p < 0.001) and reduced time to first defaecation (mean difference –1.07 days; 95% CI –1.40 to –0.73; p < 0.001).

Harms.evidence: No significant differences were observed in safety outcomes, including anastomotic leak (OR 0.97; 95% CI 0.53 to 1.77), nasogastric tube reinsertion (OR 0.86; 95% CI 0.49 to 1.51), or readmission rates (OR 1.03; 95% CI 0.62 to 1.72).
